document_data.caption: A sabiki rig.
document_data.name: Sabiki
document_data.Description: A sabiki rig consisted of a set of multiple hooked lines with a single lure and sinker. It was developed by [[Kozakuran]] fishermen for catching oceanic baitfish.
document_data.History: Originating in Kozakura, the sabiki eventually found its way to [[northwest Faer√ªn]] by the 15{{th}} century [[DR]], where it proved especially adept at snaring [[candlefish]] and clumps of [[marimo]]. Fishing contest organizers found its use unfair, given the amount of hooks involved.
